title: Understanding Enthalpy of Formation
text: The standard enthalpy change of a reaction can be calculated using the standard enthalpies of formation of the reactants and products. Use the formula: ΔH° $$=$$ ΣΔH°_f(products) - ΣΔH°_f(reactants).

title: Identify the Enthalpies of Formation
text: Identify the standard enthalpies of formation for each substance in the reaction from the image provided.

title: Calculate for Products
text: Calculate the total enthalpy of formation for the products: $$2$$ moles of NO₂ and $$2$$ moles of H₂O. Use the values from the image.

title: Calculate for Reactants
text: Calculate the total enthalpy of formation for the reactants: $$1$$ mole of N₂H₄ and $$3$$ moles of O₂. Use the values from the image.

title: Apply the Formula
text: Substitute the calculated values into the formula: ΔH° $$=$$ ΣΔH°_f(products) - ΣΔH°_f(reactants) to find the standard enthalpy change of the reaction.
